https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/488.name: IBM Call for Code University Edition
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/488.description:
Now in its third year, the Call for Code Global Challenge is a multi-year global initiative that rallies developers, visionaries, and problem solvers to create practical, effective, and high-quality applications based on cloud, data, and artificial intelligence that can have an immediate and lasting impact on humanitarian issues. Call for Code brings start-up, academic, community, and enterprise developers together and inspires them to solve the most pressing societal issues of our time.

This year’s Call for Code Challenge has been expanded to two tracks in order to tackle two life-altering world problems: COVID-19 and climate change. These issues have the power to compromise our health, our planet and our survival - and need to be addressed now. More information about this year’s challenge can be found on the Challenge homepage: https://callforcode.org/

Additionally, in partnership with the Clinton Global Initiative University (CGI U), we are launching the inaugural University Edition of the 2020 Call for Code Global Challenge. This will activate student developers, like you, to tackle these world problems. Through a series of virtual hackathons, workshops and other learning opportunities, you will be enabled with the skills necessary to work as a team and create solutions to these issues.

The 2020 Call for Code Global Challenge - University Edition will kick-off on Earth Day, April 22, with a virtual introduction by IBM’s Chief Developer Advocate and GM Willie Tejada and a special guest speaker to be revealed soon! Following the session, which will include a Q&A, our developer advocates will host workshops to get you started on your projects.

Stay tuned in the Slack Workspace (add the #University channel) for information on upcoming virtual hackathons, enablement sessions, office hours and more!

We will be supporting you every step of the way. From helping you construct a team, to ideation sessions. From roadblocks in your project, to how to present what you’ve created. For any problem you run into, there will be an IBMer excited to work through it with you.

You are the future, and we hope you will join us by answering the call to make a brighter tomorrow for our planet. There has never been a more important time than right now to use technology for good.


Here are some helpful links to get you started!
April 22 Event Registration link:
https://cgiu.cgiforms.org/view.php?id=141342

Helpful COVID Code Patterns
https://github.ibm.com/spackows/AI-ContentOps/tree/master/COVID-19

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/505.name: Yelping From Home: The Tech Talk Series
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/505.location: Any Handshake student with a link to this event can view and RSVP
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/505.description:
***RSVP via Eventbrite (https://bit.ly/2LOQtdw)***

Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses, and one of the teams working behind the scenes to make that happen is our five star engineering and product teams.

Playing an active role in our community is a value that we have strongly prioritized over the years. Typically we would invite you to come to Yelp’s HQ to network, grab a slice of ‘za, and learn about the technology and culture behind Yelp. With stay-at-home orders across the globe, Yelp (like many of you) has had no choice but to adapt to these changes. We understand that this is a strange and challenging time for many, so we’d like to invite you to join us as we navigate this new normal for the tech community together. 

To stay connected, create space for folks to collaborate and share some of the things Yelp has been working on, we are launching our very own virtual tech talk series. This series of talks will feature Yelpers from engineering and product and will focus on themes such as career development, technical skills, workplace challenges and Yelp’s response to COVID-19.

Join us to hear "Code Review Etiquette" by Surashree Kulkarni and "5 Things We Wish We Knew When We Started Working as SWEs" by Banafsheh Derayat and Vanessa Gutierrez.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/490.description:
Hire Up Virtual Career Fair
What is the Hire UP Virtual Career Fair?
The Hire UP Virtual Career Fair provides an opportunity for employers and job seekers to connect and network online. For employers seeking to expand their pipeline of tech talent, the Hire UP event is and time efficient solution to recruitment efforts.  

Our hope is to connect displaced and underemployed regional workers with local companies who are hiring technical/corporate employees. For companies who are not hiring and/or have had layoffs, this could serve as outplacement support for displaced workers. 

WHEN: May 27, 2020 | 11 am to 3 pm
WHERE: Anywhere with an internet connection

What type of candidate is invited?
The main purpose of the event is for employers to recruit technical talent. Non-technical talent may attend, and employers may post non-technical jobs, however the focus is on tech roles. 
• Candidates seeking Full-time, Part-time, and Internships
• Recruit graduate and undergraduate talent

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/489.name: 2020 FUTURE NOW Media & Entertainment Conference
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/489.description:
APPLY NOW: http://www.futurenowconference.com/the-conference

FUTURE NOW Media & Entertainment Conference is the first conference of its kind, bringing unprecedented access and opportunity for leaders on the forefront of the industry and top college and graduate students to connect, learn, and grow together!

The industry’s most influential leaders, senior executives and professionals share insights about the broadcast, cable and digital media businesses along with the latest trends and emerging technologies. Through keynotes, panel discussions, workshops and intimate mentoring sessions, media professionals share about how to succeed in the industry and the range of possible job opportunities.

This is a rare and incredible learning and networking opportunity for students to make meaningful connections that will better prepare and position them to pursue their careers upon graduation.

The application materials of those accepted to attend the conference are included in a TALENT RESOURCE PORTFOLIO that FUTURE NOW provides to sponsors and executives in attendance as a resource to help fill internship and job openings. This is not a guarantee for a job, but it is a great opportunity for students to get noticed by companies present at the conference and not get lost in an online abyss!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/428.name: Learn2Lead - Crowe Summer Leadership Program
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/428.description:
Firm Overview
Visit Crowecareers.com and find out what it's like to work at one of the “50 Best Workplaces for New College Graduates.” Crowe ranked seventh on this 2016 Fortune list and was highly rated in survey feedback.
Crowe LLP (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Crowe uses its deep industry expertise to provide audit services to public and private entities while also helping clients reach their goals with tax, advisory, risk and performance services. Crowe is recognized by many organizations as one of the country's best places to work. Crowe serves clients worldwide as an independent member of Crowe Global, one of the largest global accounting networks in the world. The network consists of more than 200 independent accounting and advisory services firms in more than 130 countries around the world.
Crowe Seeks Leaders | Summer Leadership Program, Learn2Lead (L2L)
Are you currently considering career options in public accounting, consulting, or technology? Would you like to enhance your leadership & team work skills while enriching your career knowledge & possibly finding a future internship? Do you like meeting & networking with professionals & fellow students from top universities/colleges in the US? Are you interested in what a national top public accounting, consulting, & technology firm can offer you? 
L2L is designed to provide leading students from select universities and colleges, the opportunity to learn more about Crowe’s core values, energizing culture, and our client services. While having fun and developing yourself professionally, programming may include team building exercises, leadership presentations, and/or professional business skill workshops. These activities are aimed at educating you on the leadership qualities needed to excel in the consulting arena.
Internship Opportunities Following the L2L Program
Attend L2L and you will also be considered for future opportunities with Crowe including 2021 internships. You will have the opportunity to work with clients to help determine their business needs, along with assisting companies in defining, designing, developing, and implementing business and technology solutions that provide critical value to their organization. 
L2L Key Requirements

•	Seeking a degree in one of the following preferred majors or similar background: 
o	Accounting
-      Computer Science / Computer Engineering (or related major)
o	Information Systems (or related major)
o	Informatics (or related major)
o	Supply Chain Mgmt., Operations (or related major)
o	Finance, Business Administration, Economics (or related major)

•	Minimum GPA of 3.2 required.  Minimum GPA of 3.4 preferred. 
•	Current Freshman, Sophomore or Junior 
•	Permanent resident and/or U.S. Citizen.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/503.name: Annapurna Partners(Real estate private equity)- Virtual Info Session with Principal Michael Mogull
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/503.description:
You will Learn:

-How Mr. Mogull initially got into the real estate business and his background in the space over the last two decades.
-What Mr. Mogull's role is as Managing Principal of a real estate PE firm.
-What makes Annapurna different in their approach to the real estate private equity space.
-How to leverage the mentorship offered through our internship academy to compress time frames for career growth as a business leader and real estate professional.
-You will learn about the various employment opportunities available within our rapidly growing team. Current job opportunities include Acquisitions (Business Development) roles and Annapurna Academy, a 24-month internship/apprenticeship training program.
-What intrinsic character traits Annapurna looks for when he is recruiting future leaders for the firm.
-The pros and cons of working for a larger company versus a smaller company at the beginning of your career, and what Mr. Mogull wishes he did differently himself.
-Why the covid 19 pandemic is not something we see as a long term impediment to our growth.



About US:
Annapurna Partners is a private real estate investment, development and management firm. We identify commercial real estate opportunities by taking an entrepreneurial approach to create stakeholder value. Our strategies are opportunistic, focusing on building value and mitigating risk, while leveraging relationships with our large network of strategic sponsors and advisors throughout the United States. This team identifies, analyzes, develops, and operates investments from start to finish. Based in Fort Lauderdale, Annapurna Partners employs a strong team of corporate, financial, and operational and construction professionals.

To learn more please visit www.annapurnapartners.com

Fellowships Available: Protect our nation’s security as a Department of Energy NNSA Graduate Fellow. NGFP is seeking highly motivated graduate-level students to grow as the next generation of national security leaders. The one-year, salaried (with benefits) fellowships offer:
• Hands-on experience in national security and nonproliferation;
• Career development, professional networking, and specialized training events; and
• Extensive interaction and collaboration with leading national security technology and policy experts.

These positions are open to students actively pursuing their master’s or doctoral degree as well as students who have achieved their graduate degree within the past 18 months. Details about the program can be found on at https://www.pnnl.gov/projects/ngfp The current application deadline is October 2, 2020 for positions that will begin in June 2021.

During our 1-hour Zoom webinar, a panel of current PDT Partners technologists will talk about their career paths that led them to our firm, projects they’re currently working on, and commonly asked questions they've received from people outside the quantitative finance industry. A career in quant finance shouldn’t feel out of reach. Our engineers come from a wide variety of backgrounds, ranging from startups and big tech, to well-known financial institutions.  We’re always looking for growth-minded individuals from any industry who love digging into data-driven problems.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/509.name: Virtual Session:  Office of the Secretary of Defense now hiring analysts
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/509.description:
Nat Horner (CMU EPP PhD '16) will describe hiring opportunities for analysts in Cost Assessment and Program Evaluation (CAPE) in the Office of the Secretary of Defense.

CAPE traces its lineage to Secretary McNamara's "Whiz Kids" -- an effort to bring objective, quantitative analysis to Pentagon decision making. The office is part think tank, part consulting firm, and part investigative agency, with the mission of providing its sole client—the Secretary of Defense—with timely, insightful, and unbiased analysis to aid strategic decisions. CAPE analysts have impact: our work informs decision makers at the highest levels of the Department and directly affects a $700B budget.

Requirements: Graduate education in quantitative fields; demonstrated analytical ability; a desire to make sense of the strategic picture; curiosity to learn about new topics; and an ability to lead cross-organizational teams.

Benefits: Exposure to the highest levels of the Department; the ability to see direct outcomes from your analysis; a cadre of smart, dedicated colleagues; the opportunity to network across DoD; streamlined hiring and promotion.

Nat has experience in other government agencies, think tanks, and research centers. He thinks CAPE is an awesome place to work, but is also happy to answer general questions about government and government-adjacent employment, as well as available fellowship programs. Stop by and say hi!

Moody's is an essential component of the global capital markets, providing credit ratings, research, tools and analysis that contribute to transparent and integrated financial markets. Moody's Corporation is the parent company of Moody's Investors Service, which provides credit ratings and research covering debt instruments and securities, and Moody's Analytics, which offers leading-edge software, advisory services and research for credit and economic analysis and financial risk management.

Are you interested in joining a community of developers at the intersection of finance and technology? For more details about the MATR program – go to our website at https://careers.moodys.com/students-and-graduates/moodys-analytics-technology-rotation-program/.

Please join us on Wednesday, July 1st at 7:00p.m. Eastern Time, for our Wealth Management Banking Specialist Virtual Career Event.

Are you interested in launching a career with Bank of America/Merrill Lynch? Do you want to be at the forefront of the future of banking, with the ability to make financial lives better and the power to make a difference?

If so, we invite you to join us for this interactive event to hear firsthand from some of our leaders and top talent, and learn how you can build a successful career within Wealth Management Banking.

Wealth Management Banking Specialists partner with our Merrill Financial Advisors to provide banking solutions to individual wealth management clients with assets generally in the range of $1-10 million.  This includes providing consistent, thorough and transparent experiences that give clients knowledge of banking, digital and credit solutions. Wealth Management Banking Specialists have access to industry leading financial solutions and a team of dedicated product specialists – all designed to meet the unique life priorities of clients – priorities like managing operating expense, building wealth, financing, managing debt, buying a home, saving for college or planning for unexpected life events.  

Training is provided by our award-winning Academy at Bank of America. This program delivers hands-on practice, personalized coaching and classes that will help Wealth Management Banking Specialists become the specialists they want to be. With demonstrated success, there is career growth and the opportunity to advance in many roles within our company.

In this interactive webcast our team will:

•	Share Bank of America benefits
•	Offer candid insight on personal career experience
•	Show the extensive opportunities available with Bank of America/Merrill Lynch 

Event Times:
•	7:00pm-8:00pm ET

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/517.name: Yelping From Home: The Tech Talk Series
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/517.location: Any Handshake student with a link to this event can view and RSVP
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/517.description:
***Please RSVP via Eventbrite***

Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses, and one of the teams working behind the scenes to make that happen is our five star engineering and product teams.

Playing an active role in our community is a value that we have strongly prioritized over the years. Typically we would invite you to come to Yelp’s HQ to network, grab a slice of ‘za, and learn about the technology and culture behind Yelp. With stay-at-home orders across the globe, Yelp (like many of you) has had no choice but to adapt to these changes. We understand that this is a strange and challenging time for many, so we’d like to invite you to join us as we navigate this new normal for the tech community together.

To stay connected, create space for folks to collaborate and share some of the things Yelp has been working on, we are launching our very own virtual tech talk series. This series of talks will feature Yelpers from engineering and product and will focus on themes such as career development, technical skills, workplace challenges and Yelp’s response to COVID-19.

Emil Hessel, Product Manager
Talk: Good Products in Tough Times

2020 has fundamentally transformed the landscape for local businesses and the customers they serve. For many of us, where and how we get food, shop, and even exercise are dramatically different than they were four months ago. With this, the need to stay up-to-date and connected with the businesses in our communities is more universal than ever. One of Yelp's newest products, Yelp Connect, is designed to fill this need. Join us as we talk about how we built an idea into a product used by thousands of businesses to help in their fight for survival. We'll explain what Yelp Connect is, how it's helping businesses and consumers in today's environment, and some key product insights we picked up along the way.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/515.name: Getting career-ready whilst making a difference; globally, domestically or virtually.
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/515.description:
Secure practical skills and industry experience that put you ahead of the graduate pack, whilst achieving a sustainable social impact with an internship that you can do internationally, in rural Australia, or from the comfort of your home! 

At Project Everest Ventures, we believe that tackling global challenges won't be achieved by doing what's always been done before. With three  unique Impact Programs, this is your chance to tailor your own personal and professional growth, gain skills that top recruiters crave, and do work experience that’s not only good...but good for the world.

Join recent graduates, Abbey and Alice, as they discuss their own experiences of working in international development in a variety of roles with Project Everest, and how they’ve used these skills to cement a successful and fulfilling career path. They’ll be covering topics such as:
· The UN’s Sustainable Development Goals as collective targetsfor the next 10 years
· The current state of the world and the importance of these goals for the future of mankind
· The issues with charity and government when addressing these challenges
· The concept of of social enterprise and how business can change the world 
· The nature of the working world for grads and how you can effectively prepare during uni.
· Specifics on how Project Everest  operates in this space; our impact projects and opportunities for students
· Live Q&A

Too many young people report feelings of helplessness when facing the issues of our time; feeling excluded, helpless or incapable of making a real difference. 

Hear genuine stories and advice from new STEM graduates, who utilised the available opportunities during their studies to build out their skills, networks and confidence, and ultimately securing graduate employment with a leading social enterprise. 

You’ll leave this session having a better understanding of how business has a core role to play in tackling the today’s biggest challenges, the potential for young minds to greatly contribute and get stuck into making their mark on the world, and the work Project Everest is currently doing: globally and online.

Join us on July 16 at 2-3 p.m. ET for the third of a six-part live chat series with fellows. Get answers to your questions from current fellows and staff! Hear what it's like to be a fellow in all three branches of the federal government.

The AAAS Science & Technology Policy Fellowships is a paid, yearlong opportunity for professional development and public service for outstanding scientists, social scientists and engineers. Fellows come from a wide range of disciplines, sectors and career stages. Fellows are postdocs, faculty on sabbatical, and other scientists and engineers looking to develop new skills as they grow in their careers.

The AAAS S&T Policy Fellowships (STPF) are open to U.S. citizens who hold doctoral-level degrees in any of the following:

• Biological, Physical or Earth Sciences.
• Medical and Health Sciences.
• Social and Behavioral Sciences.
• Computational, Information & Data Sciences.
• Mathematics & Statistics.

Individuals with a MS in Engineering plus three years of professional experience are also eligible for this program.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.name: GSA Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning End-User License Agreement Challenge 2020
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.description:
GSA Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning End-User License Agreement Challenge 2020


 TOTAL CASH PRIZES OFFERED: $20,000
 TYPE OF CHALLENGE: Software and apps
 SUBMISSION START: 07/06/2020 10:00 AM ET
 SUBMISSION END: 08/20/2020 05:00 PM ET

Description

The goal of this challenge is to develop an artificial intelligence (AI), or machine learning (ML) solution that will review end-user license agreements (EULA) for terms and conditions that are unacceptable to the government. On average it takes all parties involved approximately 7-14 days to review an EULA and ensure that all unacceptable terms and conditions are identified.

A EULA details the rights and restrictions which apply to the use of software or services. It can also be known as a software license agreement or acceptable use policy. As part of the acquisition process of software or services, GSA reviews the associated EULAs. This review must be completed prior to awarding new contracts or modifying existing contracts. A GSA contracting officer (CO) reviews applicable EULAs for terms and conditions that are not in accordance with Federal law and regulations. The CO may also coordinate a legal review with the Office of General Counsel if they feel it is warranted. Should EULAs contain language that would conflict with Federal law and regulations, the CO must negotiate changes to the EULA to remove the problematic language.

We are looking for a solution that will use AI and/or ML to improve this manual process. The solution will include a user interface that GSA will use to process the documents and identify unacceptable clauses/terms in the EULAs. Watch our AI / ML challenge video to learn more about the desired solution.

This solution will decrease the time spent manually reviewing EULAs and free resources to focus on other aspects of the acquisition process. It will also improve the accuracy and consistency of the review process.


Youtube video announcing GSA ML/AI Challenge - https://youtu.be/uOBFIqoOJ8k

Website with complete details - https://www.challenge.gov/challenge/GSA-artificial-intelligence-AI-machine-learning-ML-challenge/

Key Facts:
·      Registration begins: 10 a.m. ET, July 6, 2020
·      Submit solutions before: 5 p.m. ET, August 20, 2020
·      Semi-finalists announced: 10 a.m. ET, September 4, 2020
·      Winner announced: 10 a.m. ET, September 11, 2020
·      Each challenge solver (individual, team, or legal entity) is required to register by sending an email to challenge2020@gsa.gov with the subject line stating ‘Challenge 2020 Registration’.

·      Cash prizes for winning teams:
o  1st place team: $15,000.00
o  2nd place team: $2,500.00
o  3rd place team: $2,500.00

·      Questions? emailchallenge2020@gsa.gov for more information.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.name: Yelping From Home: The Tech Talk Series
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.description:
To stay connected, create space for folks to collaborate and share some of the things Yelp has been working on, we are launching our very own virtual tech talk series. This series of talks will feature Yelpers from engineering and product and will focus on themes such as career development, technical skills, workplace challenges and Yelp’s response to COVID-19.

Talk: Creating Meaningful Data Through Rich Contextual Logging Across Microservice

As engineers, we need data to support our decisions. However, it is a huge step from “we have data” to “we have meaningful data”. At Yelp, we use contextual logging to allow data consumers to connect any data sources. In this talk, Kangni will talk about how contextual logging is adopted across Yelp’s microservices via context propagation, and the challenges we encountered.

Kangni Wang
Bio: Kangni has been a software engineer on the experimentation team at Yelp for the last 2.5 years. Prior to Yelp, she completed her Bachelor's degree in Computer Science at Harvey Mudd College.

Talk: Fuelling Your Career With Coffee Chats

One of the best ways to meet people and launch your career is to set up short chats over coffee. But, there are no guidelines and it can be daunting to start. We'll go over the individual stages of a coffee chat, from asking someone to transforming it into a mentorship. You’ll pick up tools to have meaningful conversations and walk away with a game plan to get started!

Sherry Yuan
Bio: Sherry is an Android engineer at Yelp working on the Yelp for Business Owners Android app. Prior to starting at Yelp, she studied computer science at the University of British Columbia, where she started a coffee chat program with Daphne. She is passionate about Android development, diversity in tech, and creative and technical writing.

Daphne Liu
Bio: Daphne is an Android engineer who enjoys meeting new people and branching out outside her team. She shares her interests in tech, mentorship and diversity by speaking at conferences, writing blogs, and being involved with the Women in CS club she founded at her university. She is currently finishing up her last year of school at the University of British Columbia.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/525.description:
**Please RSVP through Eventbrite**

Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses, and one of the teams working behind the scenes to make that happen is our five star engineering and product teams.

Playing an active role in our community is a value that we have strongly prioritized over the years. Typically we would invite you to come to Yelp’s HQ to network, grab a slice of ‘za, and learn about the technology and culture behind Yelp. With stay-at-home orders across the globe, Yelp (like many of you) has had no choice but to adapt to these changes. We understand that this is a strange and challenging time for many, so we’d like to invite you to join us as we navigate this new normal for the tech community together.

To stay connected, create space for folks to collaborate and share some of the things Yelp has been working on, we are launching our very own virtual tech talk series. This series of talks will feature Yelpers from engineering and product and will focus on themes such as career development, technical skills, workplace challenges and Yelp’s response to COVID-19.

Talk: Why you should pursue public speaking and how to get there

Starting a tech career as a minority is challenging. It could mean being the only one to speak against the popular opinion, or becoming more visible to get the same level of recognition.

Public speaking helps you achieve that and more. This talk shares tips on how to overcome the fear and ways to get started. Attendees will be prepared to brace for presenting from a team meeting to a conference.Yenny Cheung

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.name: GSA Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning End-User License Agreement Challenge 2020
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.description:
GSA Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning End-User License Agreement Challenge 2020


 TOTAL CASH PRIZES OFFERED: $20,000
 TYPE OF CHALLENGE: Software and apps
 SUBMISSION START: 07/06/2020 10:00 AM ET
 SUBMISSION END: 08/20/2020 05:00 PM ET

Description

The goal of this challenge is to develop an artificial intelligence (AI), or machine learning (ML) solution that will review end-user license agreements (EULA) for terms and conditions that are unacceptable to the government. On average it takes all parties involved approximately 7-14 days to review an EULA and ensure that all unacceptable terms and conditions are identified.

A EULA details the rights and restrictions which apply to the use of software or services. It can also be known as a software license agreement or acceptable use policy. As part of the acquisition process of software or services, GSA reviews the associated EULAs. This review must be completed prior to awarding new contracts or modifying existing contracts. A GSA contracting officer (CO) reviews applicable EULAs for terms and conditions that are not in accordance with Federal law and regulations. The CO may also coordinate a legal review with the Office of General Counsel if they feel it is warranted. Should EULAs contain language that would conflict with Federal law and regulations, the CO must negotiate changes to the EULA to remove the problematic language.

We are looking for a solution that will use AI and/or ML to improve this manual process. The solution will include a user interface that GSA will use to process the documents and identify unacceptable clauses/terms in the EULAs. Watch our AI / ML challenge video to learn more about the desired solution.

This solution will decrease the time spent manually reviewing EULAs and free resources to focus on other aspects of the acquisition process. It will also improve the accuracy and consistency of the review process.


Youtube video announcing GSA ML/AI Challenge - https://youtu.be/uOBFIqoOJ8k

Website with complete details - https://www.challenge.gov/challenge/GSA-artificial-intelligence-AI-machine-learning-ML-challenge/

Key Facts:
·      Registration begins: 10 a.m. ET, July 6, 2020
·      Submit solutions before: 5 p.m. ET, August 20, 2020
·      Semi-finalists announced: 10 a.m. ET, September 4, 2020
·      Winner announced: 10 a.m. ET, September 11, 2020
·      Each challenge solver (individual, team, or legal entity) is required to register by sending an email to challenge2020@gsa.gov with the subject line stating ‘Challenge 2020 Registration’.

·      Cash prizes for winning teams:
o  1st place team: $15,000.00
o  2nd place team: $2,500.00
o  3rd place team: $2,500.00

·      Questions? emailchallenge2020@gsa.gov for more information.

Heinz College Public Service Fair
The Public Service Fair is an opportunity for Heinz students to find local non-profit and government organizations to find remote intern, work study, or volunteer positions during the fall and spring semesters. Many organizations in attendance hire through the paid Federal Community Service Work Study program. Others provide excellent volunteer opportunities. https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/career_fai.name: Technical Opportunities Conference + Encompass + Converge Virtual Career Fair 2020
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/career_fai.description:
REGISTRATION IS AVAILABLE USING THE CAREERECO PLATFORM - SEE THE LINKS BELOW
The Technical Opportunities Conference + Encompass + Converge Virtual Career Fair 2020 will take place from Monday, September 14th through Wednesday, September 16th from 1:00 pm - 9:00pm EDT.  
The fall 2020 virtual career fair is open to all Carnegie Mellon University undergraduate and graduate students of all majors and locations, who are pursuing full-time opportunities and internships. The virtual fair will also be open to recent alumni who have graduated from December 2019-August 2020. 
The Virtual Career Fair will be hosted on the platform, "CareerEco" please create an account using your Andrew email and register for each day of the virtual fair using the links below:
Register Here:Day 1: https://www.careereco.com/Events/CMU-Sept14
Day 2: https://www.careereco.com/Events/CMU-Sept15
Day 3: https://www.careereco.com/Events/CMU-Sept16
We understand that participating in a virtual recruiting environment will be different than participating in person, but this joint virtual career fair will also present our students with new opportunities, such as:
● Uploading resumes into the virtual platform in advance to give employers more time to review your qualifications, which increases your opportunity to stand out.● Checking the CareerEco platform ahead of time to more efficiently and effectively identify the employers that are the best fit for you, which allows you to easily identify the most important details you need to know.● Accessing more companies than could traditionally be accommodated in-person, which means more opportunities will be available to you in a broader array of majors.● No waiting in line, which gives you the ability to talk to more employers and provides more flexibility to easily come and go.Lastly, the CPDC will be providingmoreinformationonhowtoprepforthevirtualcareerfair aswell asotherhelpful information asitgetsclosertotheevent.We are excited about this fall’s recruiting and look forward to your participation!Learn more about CareerEco (Virtual Fair Platform):Virtual Event Tutorial PDFVirtual Event Tutorial VideoQuestions?

We’re looking for both digital business consultants and technologists[data scientists, software engineers, data engineers, and designers] that are excited to blend analytics, design, and engineering thinking with our McKinsey teams and experts to help our clients solve their top challenges. From day one, you’ll be part of a multi-disciplinary McKinsey team that applies technology to help clients shape their strategy, transform their organizations, and build new businesses to create positive change. We hope you will consider starting your journey with us, so you can be at your best at McKinsey Digital. 

If you are a student with a STEM background and anticipate completing your program or degree in 2021 or 2022, please join us for one of our upcoming virtual info sessions to learn more about McKinsey’s 2021 full-time and internship opportunities for university students.  

Interested in learning more?

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/499.name: STPF Live Chat: The Perks of Being a Fellow: Networking, Influence and Impact
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/499.location: Any Handshake student with a link to this event can view and RSVP
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/499.description:
Join us on August 20 at 1-2 p.m. ET for the fourth of a six-part live chat series with fellows. Get answers to your questions from current fellows and staff!

The AAAS Science & Technology Policy Fellowships is a paid, yearlong opportunity for professional development and public service for outstanding scientists, social scientists and engineers. Fellows come from a wide range of disciplines, sectors and career stages. Fellows are postdocs, faculty on sabbatical, and other scientists and engineers looking to develop new skills as they grow in their careers.

The AAAS S&T Policy Fellowships (STPF) are open to U.S. citizens who hold doctoral-level degrees in any of the following:

• Biological, Physical or Earth Sciences.
• Medical and Health Sciences.
• Social and Behavioral Sciences.
• Computational, Information & Data Sciences.
• Mathematics & Statistics.

Individuals with a MS in Engineering plus three years of professional experience are also eligible for this program.
